definitions.definition: the system of voting in writing and usually in secret; an occasion on which a vote is held
definitions.labels: (especially North American English)(especially British English)(North American English)(British English)(especially British English)(North American English)(British English)(especially North American English)

examples.text: The chairperson is chosen by **secret ballot**.
The union cannot call a strike unless it **holds a ballot** of members.
a ballot for the Conservative leadership
a ballot on the new contracts
The club members decided in a ballot to suspend the captain.
The jury cast their vote by secret ballot.
They voted against him at the second ballot.

definitions.definition: the piece of paper on which somebody marks who they are voting for

examples.text: What percentage of eligible voters **cast their ballots**?

definitions.definition: the total number of votes in an election

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (originally denoting a small coloured ball placed in a container to register a vote): from Italian ballotta, diminutive of balla.
